trustfund:
TF035858-ROMANIA - SECOND ROADS PROJECT,TF032337-ARMENIA - TRANSPORT SECTOR,TF032254-REPUBLIC OF ARMENIA - HIGHWAY
            PROJECT (TRANSPORT SECTOR),TF031356-ARMENIA - TRANSPORT SECTOR,TF025535-PHRD-TRANSPORT PROJECT,TF032103-ARMENIA - TRANSPORT,TF029134-PHRD-HIGHWAY PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and institutional
            development impacts substantial, with a highly satisfactory
            Bank performance, - given the project's consistency
            with the country's development strategy, the fast
            project implementation, and the appropriateness of resources
            allocation - and, a satisfactory performance by the Borrower
            in light of its timely, and cooperative manner. Lessons
            emphasize the importance of strong counterparts to achieve
            success, exemplified by the Armenia Road Directorate's
            leadership, and excellent judgment in selecting experienced
            staff in road technology, well prepared, and qualified to
            assimilate Bank guidelines, and operational methods. Thus,
            the selection, and training of new staff will be critical to
            the following transport operation. Moreover, the conscious
            efforts in minimizing costs, through the use of economic
            analysis, competitive bidding, and improved road maintenance
            technology, led to an overall road costs reduction of fifty
            percent compared to the last years of the Soviet period, a
            factor worthy of mention when considering restructuring, and
            revision of roads administration, and operations. However,
            the persistent inadequacy of funding for road maintenance
            within the budgetary process - even when road user charges
            generate adequate income - suggests the Bank should review
            the institutional, legal, public acceptance, and planning
            issues, to determine, if a road tariff could replace the
            road user charge part of the excise tax on fuel, for such a
            tariff could establish a level playing field, to ensure
            predictable road budgets.
